head.supplied: Police Department, ¶ Chief Office, ¶ Perth, ¶ November 29th ¶ 1887 ¶ W. ¶ Or C (for Chas)? ¶ Wisbey ¶ ¶ Baron Müller is proceeding via Bunbury & Bridgetown to Albany via Muir's...

div.p: From Matthew Smith to William Wisbey
Cons 129, no. 25/645, State Records Office of Western Australia, Perth.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; font-style: italic;

div.p:
To proof.
complete the details. This letter is marked 25/645.
Police Department,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; font-style: italic;

div.p: Baron Müller is proceeding via Bunbury & Bridgetown to Albany via Muir's

P.C. Hogan accompanies the Baron to Bunbury. I wish you to make arrangements for some Constable to accompany him from Bunbury to Bridgetown and across to Albany. Some one who know the road well and is able to drive and look after horses — The horses are Police — Trap & Horses are to be looked after by the Police wherever the Baron may wish to go — I wish you to see that every assistance is rendered to him . I wish Hogan to return from Bunbury & the mail Cab. — I suppose Booth
Evidently a police constable; not further identified. would be the best man to take the Baron across to Albany from Bridgetown, but that I leave to you. The trap & horses are to be brought back to Perth from Albany as Baron Müller goes on to Melbourne from the latter place. —

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Supt of Police
See W. Wisbey to […] Monger, 8 December 1877. On 21 December, P. Furlong, Superintendent of Police minuted: 'P.C. Bovell and nat Asst arrived with Baron Von Müeller yesterday 20th Instant — all right — Bovell & native have been instructed to return to their station taking [Mr] Blondies from Mount Barker to which place he is to take the Superintendents Trap & horses, from whence they will be forwarded to Perth'.
